meanings.definition: Naltrexones: a drug used to treat alcohol and opioid dependence.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed naltrexones to help with my alcohol addiction.
meanings.sent2: Many people rely on naltrexones to overcome their opioid dependence.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook naltrexones for candy, thinking it would magically cure my cravings.
meanings.sent4: Her journey to recovery was like a ship guided by naltrexones through stormy seas of addiction.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of naltrexones reminded her of the sun rising on a new, sober day.

meanings.sent1: The pharmacy ran out of naltrexones, so I had to wait for a new shipment.
meanings.sent2: The researchers needed a large quantity of naltrexones for their study on addiction treatment.
meanings.sent3: The box of naltrexones on the shelf looked like a colorful army ready to fight addiction battles.
meanings.sent4: In the lab, the vials of naltrexones stood together like a united front against substance abuse.
meanings.sent5: The community clinic provided free naltrexones to those in need of support on their sober journey.
